intro: Aspidixia semiplana, commonly known as the flat-leaf aspidixia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive flat, broad leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Aspidixia semiplana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
